titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

titles.ar: بَابُ الْمِرَاءِ وَ الْخُصُومَةِ وَ مُعَادَاةِ الرِّجَالِ
titles.en: Chapter 120 – The quarreling, and the disputing, and the animosity to the men
THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/141)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) الْغَضَبُ يُفْسِدُ الْإِيمَانَ كَمَا يُفْسِدُ الْخَلُّ الْعَسَلَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘Rasool-Allahsaww said: ‘The anger spoils the Emān just as the vinegar spoils the honey’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “The Messenger of Allah has said, ‘Anger spoils belief just as vinegar spoils honey.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/144)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُيَسِّرٍ قَالَ

text: ذُكِرَ الْغَضَبُ عِنْدَ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ إِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَغْضَبُ فَمَا يَرْضَى أَبَداً حَتَّى يَدْخُلَ النَّارَ فَأَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ غَضِبَ عَلَى قَوْمٍ وَ هُوَ قَائِمٌ فَلْيَجْلِسْ مِنْ فَوْرِهِ ذَلِكَ فَإِنَّهُ سَيَذْهَبُ عَنْهُ رِجْزُ الشَّيْطَانِ وَ أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ غَضِبَ عَلَى ذِي رَحِمَ فَلْيَدْنُ مِنْهُ فَلْيَمَسَّهُ فَإِنَّ الرَّحِمَ إِذَا مُسَّتْ سَكَنَتْ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ali Bin Uqba, from his father, from Muyassar who said,

‘The anger was mentioned in the presence of Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When the man is angered, so he would not be pleased ever, until he enters the Fire. Therefore, whenever a man gets angry upon a people while he is standing, so let him sit down straight away, so the filth of Satan<sup>la</sup> would go away from him; and whenever a man is angered upon a relative, so let him go closer to him and let him touch him, for the relative, when touched, calms down’.
en.sarwar: 2. Abu Ali al-Ash’ari has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from ibn Faddal from Ali ibn ‘Uqbah from his father from Muyassir who has said the following: “Once anger was mentioned before abu la’ far (a.s.) and he said, ‘Once a man is angered (unless something is done to control it) he will never become happy until he enters the fire. Therefore, whoever becomes angry with people if he is standing must sit down immediately. The filth of Satan goes away from him. Whenever one becomes angry with a relative he should reach out and touch him; when kinship is touched, it calms down.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/148)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ فَرْقَدٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الْغَضَبُ مِفْتَاحُ كُلِّ شَرٍّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, fro Dawood Bin Farqad who said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘The anger is a key to every evil’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from Dawud ibn Farqad who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Anger is the key to all evil.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/148)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبِي ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ أَتَى رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) رَجُلٌ بَدَوِيٌّ فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَسْكُنُ الْبَادِيَةَ فَعَلِّمْنِي جَوَامِعَ الْكَلَامِ فَقَالَ آمُرُكَ أَنْ لَا تَغْضَبَ فَأَعَادَ عَلَيْهِ الْأَعْرَابِيُّ الْمَسْأَلَةَ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ حَتَّى رَجَعَ الرَّجُلُ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ فَقَالَ لَا أَسْأَلُ عَنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ بَعْدَ هَذَا مَا أَمَرَنِي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِلَّا بِالْخَيْرِ
قَالَ وَ كَانَ أَبِي يَقُولُ أَيُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ أَشَدُّ مِنَ الْغَضَبِ إِنَّ الرَّجُلَ لَيَغْضَبُ فَيَقْتُلُ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ وَ يَقْذِفُ الْمُحْصَنَةَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from his father, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Al Qasim Bin Suleyman,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard my<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> father<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> saying: ‘A Bedouin man came over to Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> and he said, ‘I dwell in the desert, so teach me the comprehensive words’. So he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> said: ‘I<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> order you that you should not get angry’. So the Bedouin reiterated the question upon him<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> three times, until the man retracted it to himself and he said, ‘I shall not ask about anything after this. Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> did not order me except with the good’.

He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘And my<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> father<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> was saying: ‘Which thing is more difficult than the anger. Once the man gets angry so he kills the soul which Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> has Prohibited and he slanders the married woman’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from his father from al-Nadr ibn Suwayd from al-Qasim ibn Sulayman from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “I heard my father saying, ‘Once a Bedouin man came to the Messenger of Allah and said, “1 live in the Sahara, please teach me comprehensive words of advice.” The Messenger of Allah said, ‘I command you not to become angry.’ The man from the desert repeated his question three times. He then realized the fact and said, ‘I will not ask for anything hereinafter. The Messenger of Allah has commanded me nothing but good. ’ The Imam said, ‘My father has said, “What can be more severe (in harmfulness) than anger? A man becomes angry, he commits murder that is unlawful and accuses a married woman of committing indecent acts.’””

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالحسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/149)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْأَشْعَرِيِّ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَلِّمْنِي عِظَةً أَتَّعِظُ بِهَا فَقَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَتَاهُ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ عَلِّمْنِي عِظَةً أَتَّعِظُ بِهَا فَقَالَ لَهُ انْطَلِقْ وَ لَا تَغْضَبْ ثُمَّ أَعَادَ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لَهُ انْطَلِقْ وَ لَا تَغْضَبْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibrahim Bin Muhammad Al Ashary, from Abdul A’ala who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Teach me an advice which I can be advised with’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘A man came over to Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> and he said, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! Teach me an advice I can be advised with’. So he<sup>saww</sup> said to him: ‘Go, and don’t be angry’. Then he reiterated to him<sup>saww</sup>. So he<sup>saww</sup> said to him: ‘Go, and don’t be angry’ – three times’.
en.sarwar: 5. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ibn Faddal from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad al-Ash’ari from ‘Abd al-‘Ala who has said the following: “Once I said to abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘Please teach me good advice that will help me learn a lesson.’ The Imam said, ‘Once a man came to the Messenger of Allah and said, “O Messenger of Allah, teach me an advice that will help me learn a good lesson.” The Messenger of Allah said, ‘Go, but do not become angry.’ The man repeated his question the Messenger of Allah said three times, ‘Go and do not become angry.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/150)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَمَّنْ سَمِعَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ

text: مَنْ كَفَّ غَضَبَهُ سَتَرَ اللَّهُ عَوْرَتَهُ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ismail Bin Mihran, from Sayf Bin Ameyra,
(It has been narrated) from the one who heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The one who restrains his anger, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Veil his bareness’.
en.sarwar: 6. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from Isma’il ibn Mehran from Sayf ibn ‘ Amirah from the one who had heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying: “Whoever controls his anger, Allah covers his defects for him. ’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول أو حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/150)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ حَبِيبٍ السِّجِسْتَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَكْتُوبٌ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ فِيمَا نَاجَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِهِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) يَا مُوسَى أَمْسِكْ غَضَبَكَ عَمَّنْ مَلَّكْتُكَ عَلَيْهِ أَكُفَّ عَنْكَ غَضَبِي .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Mahboub, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Habeeb Al Sijistany,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘It is Written in the Torah, among what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Whispered to Musa<sup>as</sup> with: “O Musa<sup>as</sup>! Withhold your<sup>as</sup> anger from the one who you<sup>as</sup> have control upon, I<sup>azwj</sup> shall Restrain My<sup>azwj</sup> Anger from you<sup>as</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 7. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ibn Mahbub from Hisham ibn Salim from Habib al-Sajistani from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “It is written in the Torah of the conversations of Musa and Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, ‘O Moses, control your anger against those whom I have given you to own, I will keep my anger away from you.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/151)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ عَمْرٍو عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى بَعْضِ أَنْبِيَائِهِ يَا ابْنَ آدَمَ اذْكُرْنِي فِي غَضَبِكَ أَذْكُرْكَ فِي غَضَبِي لَا أَمْحَقْكَ فِيمَنْ أَمْحَقُ وَ ارْضَ بِي مُنْتَصِراً فَإِنَّ انْتِصَارِي لَكَ خَيْرٌ مِنِ انْتِصَارِكَ لِنَفْسِكَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Hameed, from Yahya Bin Amro, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Revealed unto one of His<sup>azwj</sup> Prophets<sup>as</sup>: “O son of Adam<sup>as</sup>! Remember Me<sup>azwj</sup> during your anger, I<sup>azwj</sup> shall Remember you during My<sup>azwj</sup> Anger and will not Eliminate you among the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> Eliminate; and be pleased with My<sup>azwj</sup> Support, for My<sup>azwj</sup> Support for you is better than your support for yourself”’.
en.sarwar: 8. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn al-Hamid from Yahya ibn ‘Amr from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, revealed to certain persons of His prophets: “O sons of Adam, remember Me in your anger, I will remember you in My anger and will not eliminate you along with the things that I eliminate. Be happy with My support; My support is better for you than your support for your own self”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/151)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَهُ

text: وَ زَادَ فِيهِ وَ إِذَا ظُلِمْتَ بِمَظْلِمَةٍ فَارْضَ بِانْتِصَارِي لَكَ فَإِنَّ انْتِصَارِي لَكَ خَيْرٌ مِنِ انْتِصَارِكَ لِنَفْسِكَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ali Bin Uqba, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, similar to it, and there is an increase in it, “And when you are oppressed with an injustice, so be please with My<sup>azwj</sup> Support for you, for My<sup>azwj</sup> Support for you is better than your support for yourself!’.
en.sarwar: 9. Abu Ali al-Ash’ari has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from ibn Faddal from Ali ibn ‘Uqbah from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) a similar Hadith with the following addition: “When injustice is done to you in an oppressive condition, be happy with My support; My support for you is better than your own support for yourself.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/152)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ مَكْتُوباً يَا ابْنَ آدَمَ اذْكُرْنِي حِينَ تَغْضَبُ أَذْكُرْكَ عِنْدَ غَضَبِي فَلَا أَمْحَقْكَ فِيمَنْ أَمْحَقُ وَ إِذَا ظُلِمْتَ بِمَظْلِمَةٍ فَارْضَ بِانْتِصَارِي لَكَ فَإِنَّ انْتِصَارِي لَكَ خَيْرٌ مِنِ انْتِصَارِكَ لِنَفْسِكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Mahboub, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘It is Written in the Torah: “O son of Adam<sup>as</sup>! Remember me when you are angered, I<sup>azwj</sup> shall Remember you during My<sup>azwj</sup> Anger, so I<sup>azwj</sup> shall not Eliminate you among the ones I<sup>azwj</sup> do Eliminate; and whenever you are oppressed with an injustice, so be pleased with My<sup>azwj</sup> Support for you, for My<sup>azwj</sup> Support for you is better than your support for yourself”’.
en.sarwar: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from ibn Mahbub from Ishaq ibn ‘ Ammar who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘It is written in the Torah: “Remember Me when you are angry so I remember you when I am angry and will not efface you along with those whom I will blot out. When injustice is done to you, accept My support; My support for you is better than your support for yourself.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/152)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمَّادٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَائِذٍ عَنْ أَبِي خَدِيجَةَ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ خُنَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِلنَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ عَلِّمْنِي قَالَ اذْهَبْ وَ لَا تَغْضَبْ فَقَالَ الرَّجُلُ قَدْ اكْتَفَيْتُ بِذَاكَ فَمَضَى إِلَى أَهْلِهِ فَإِذَا بَيْنَ قَوْمِهِ حَرْبٌ قَدْ قَامُوا صُفُوفاً وَ لَبِسُوا السِّلَاحَ

فَلَمَّا رَأَى ذَلِكَ لَبِسَ سِلَاحَهُ ثُمَّ قَامَ مَعَهُمْ ثُمَّ ذَكَرَ قَوْلَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا تَغْضَبْ فَرَمَى السِّلَاحَ ثُمَّ جَاءَ يَمْشِي إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَدُوُّ قَوْمِهِ فَقَالَ يَا هَؤُلَاءِ مَا كَانَتْ لَكُمْ مِنْ جِرَاحَةٍ أَوْ قَتْلٍ أَوْ ضَرْبٍ لَيْسَ فِيهِ أَثَرٌ فَعَلَيَّ فِي مَالِي أَنَا أُوفِيكُمُوهُ فَقَالَ الْقَوْمُ فَمَا كَانَ فَهُوَ لَكُمْ نَحْنُ أَوْلَى بِذَلِكَ مِنْكُمْ
قَالَ فَاصْطَلَحَ الْقَوْمُ وَ ذَهَبَ الْغَضَبُ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, and Ali Bin Muhammad, from Salih Bin Abu Hammad, altogether from Al Washha, from Ahmad Bin A’iz, from Abu Khadeeja, from Moalla Bin Khunays,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A man said to the Prophet<sup>saww</sup>, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! Teach me (something)’. He<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Go and don’t be angry’. So the man said, ‘I have suffice with that’. So he went to his family and he found that there was a battle in between his people, and they had lined up in rows and wearing the weapons.

So when he saw that, he (also) wore his weapon, then stood along with them. Then he remembered the words of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, ‘Don’t be angry’. So he threw down the weapon, then went walking over to the people who were the enemies of his people, and he said, ‘O you all! Whatever injuries were with you, or (if) a killing, or a strike in which there were no effects, so upon me is (the compensation for it) from my wealth. I shall fulfil it’. So the people said, ‘So whatever it was, so it is for you, (although) we are first for it with that than you are (i.e. we don’t want anything)’.
He<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘So the people reconciled and the hostility was gone’.
en.sarwar: 11. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu’alla ibn Muhammad and Ali ibn Muhammad from Salih ibn abu Hammad all from al-Washsha’ from Ahmad ibn ‘A’id from abu Khadijah from Mu’alla ibn Khanis from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Once a man said to the Holy Prophet, ‘O Messenger of Allah, teach me.’ The Messenger of Allah said, ‘You may go and do not become angry.’ The man said, ‘I have taken it as a sufficient lesson.’ He went to his family and found his people fighting, all of them lined up in arms. When he saw it he also armed himself and stood up in line with them and then he remembered the words of the Messenger of Allah, ‘Do not become angry’. He threw away his arms and moved forward to the enemies of his people and said, ‘O people, I will take responsibility for any loss of life, serious or slight injury that you may have suffered, I will pay you.’ The people said, ‘Whatever happened we give permission to go in your favor. It is more proper for us to make such undertakings.’ The Imam then said, ‘The people made peace and anger was gone.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/153)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ الثُّمَالِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ هَذَا الْغَضَبَ جَمْرَةٌ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ تُوقَدُ فِي قَلْبِ ابْنِ آدَمَ وَ إِنَّ أَحَدَكُمْ إِذَا غَضِبَ احْمَرَّتْ عَيْنَاهُ وَ انْتَفَخَتْ أَوْدَاجُهُ وَ دَخَلَ الشَّيْطَانُ فِيهِ فَإِذَا خَافَ أَحَدُكُمْ ذَلِكَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ فَلْيَلْزَمِ الْأَرْضَ فَإِنَّ رِجْزَ الشَّيْطَانِ لَيَذْهَبُ عَنْهُ عِنْدَ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, and Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, altogether from Ibn Mahboub, from Ib Raib, from Abu Hamza Al Sumaly,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘This anger is an ember from the Satan<sup>la</sup>, being inflamed in the head of the son of Adam<sup>as</sup>, and that one of you, when he gets angered, his eyes turn red, his veins puff up and Satan<sup>la</sup> enters in him. So when one of you fears that from himself, so let him hold on to the earth, for the filth of the Satan<sup>la</sup> would go away from him during that’.
en.sarwar: 12. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father all from ibn Mahbub from ibn Ri’ab from abu Hamza al-Thumali from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “This anger is a spark from Satan that he lights up in the hearts of the children of Adam. Whenever any of you becomes angry, his eyes turn red, his veins puff up and Satan enters into it. If any of you fears this, he must hold to the earth; in so doing the evil of Satan goes away.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرفوع - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (10/153)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الْغَضَبُ مَمْحَقَةٌ لِقَلْبِ الْحَكِيمِ وَ قَالَ مَنْ لَمْ يَمْلِكْ غَضَبَهُ لَمْ يَمْلِكْ عَقْلَهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from one of his companions, raising it, said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The anger is darkness for the wise heart’. And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who does not control his anger, would not (be able to) control his intellect’.
en.sarwar: 13. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn ‘Abd Allah from certain individuals of his people in a marfu’ manner has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Anger darkens the heart of a wise person.’ The Imam then said, ‘One who loses control of his anger loses his power of reason.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/155)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَاصِمِ بْنِ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ كَفَّ نَفْسَهُ عَنْ أَعْرَاضِ النَّاسِ أَقَالَ اللَّهُ نَفْسَهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَ مَنْ كَفَّ غَضَبَهُ عَنِ النَّاسِ كَفَّ اللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى عَنْهُ عَذَابَ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Aasim Bin Humeyd, from Abu Hamza,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who restrains himself from the vanities of the world, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Discharge his soul on the Day of Judgment; and the one who restrains his anger from the people, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High would Restrain the Punishment from him on the Day of Judgment’.
en.sarwar: 14. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu’alla ibn Muhammad from al- Hassan ibn Ali from ‘Asim ibn Humayd from abu Hamza from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “The Messenger of Allah has said, ‘Whoever controls his soul from hurting people, on the Day of Judgment Allah will agree to grant relief to his soul. Whoever controls his anger against people, consequently, Allah, the Most Blessed, the Most High, will, on the Day of Judgment, hold back the fire from him.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/156)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ كَفَّ غَضَبَهُ عَنِ النَّاسِ كَفَّ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ عَذَابَ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Hamza,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who restrains his anger from the people, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Restrain the Punishment from him on the Day of Judgment’.
en.sarwar: 15. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from ibn Mahbub from abu Hamza from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “Whoever controls his anger against people, consequently, Allah will, on the Day of Judgment, hold back the fire from him.”
